samples.context: Early man-like forms appeared about 7 lakhs 50 thousand years ago. The first sure fossil of our own species of man, the Homo sapiens, indicate that true man appeared on the earth 2 lakhs 50 thousand years ago.
samples.question: When did the first Homo sapiens appear?

samples.context: All human beings, even though they have different size, colour and looks, belong to the same species because they have similar DNA sequences and have descended from the same ancestors.
samples.question: What unites all human beings as a species?

samples.context: The first sure fossil of our own species of man, the Homo sapiens, indicate that true man appeared on the earth 2 lakhs 50 thousand years ago.
samples.question: What does the fossil record indicate about Homo sapiens?

samples.context: Even though they have different size, colour and looks, all human beings belong to the same species because they have similar DNA sequences.
samples.question: Why are humans considered a single species?
